content:
TemplateGroupCollection Class

In this Article

Represents a collection of TemplateGroup objects within a control designer. This class cannot be inherited.

Syntax

Declaration

public sealed class TemplateGroupCollection : System.Collections.IList

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • System.Object
  • TemplateGroupCollection

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
,
Equals(Object,Object)
,
GetHashCode()
,
GetType()
,
MemberwiseClone()
,
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
,
ToString()

Remarks

The ControlDesigner class, and any derived class, defines the TemplateGroups property as a TemplateGroupCollection object. The TemplateGroupCollection property is typically used only by a design host such as Visual Studio 2005.

The collection dynamically increases in size as objects are added. Indexes in this collection are zero-based. Use the Count property to determine how many groups are in the collection.

Additionally, use the TemplateGroupCollection methods and properties to provide the following functionality:

  • The Add method to add a single group to the collection.

  • The Insert method to add a group at a particular index within the collection.

  • The Remove method to remove a group.

  • The RemoveAt method to remove the group at a particular index.

  • The Contains method to determine whether a particular group is already in the collection.

  • The IndexOf method to retrieve the index of a group within the collection.

  • The Item indexer to get or set the group at a particular index, using array notation.

  • The AddRange method to add multiple groups to the collection.

    You can add multiple groups either as an array of groups or as a TemplateGroupCollection object that you retrieve through the TemplateGroups property of another control designer.

  • The Clear method to remove all groups from the collection.

Constructors summary

TemplateGroupCollection()

Initializes a new instance of the TemplateGroupCollection class.

Properties summary

Count

Gets the number of TemplateGroup objects in the collection.
Item(Int32)

Gets or sets a TemplateGroup object at the specified index in the collection.

Methods summary

Add(TemplateGroup)

Adds the specified TemplateGroup object to the end of the collection.
AddRange(TemplateGroupCollection)

Adds the template groups in an existing TemplateGroupCollection object to the current TemplateGroupCollection object.
Clear()

Removes all groups from the collection.
Contains(TemplateGroup)

Determines whether the specified group is contained within the collection.
CopyTo(TemplateGroup[],Int32)

Copies the groups in the collection to a compatible one-dimensional array, starting at the specified index of the target array.
IndexOf(TemplateGroup)

Returns the index of the specified TemplateGroup object within the collection.
Insert(Int32,TemplateGroup)

Inserts a TemplateGroup object into the collection at the specified index.
Remove(TemplateGroup)

Removes the specified TemplateGroup object from the collection.
RemoveAt(Int32)

Removes the TemplateGroup object at the specified index within the collection.

Constructors

  • TemplateGroupCollection()

    Initializes a new instance of the TemplateGroupCollection class.

    public TemplateGroupCollection ();

    Remarks

    Use the TemplateGroupCollection constructor to create an empty collection. You can add elements to the collection by using the Add, AddRange, or Insert method.

Properties

  • Count

    Gets the number of TemplateGroup objects in the collection.

    public int Count { get; }

    Property Value

    • Int32

      The number of TemplateGroup objects in the collection.

    Remarks

    The Count property generally is used to determine the upper boundary index when iterating through objects in the collection. Because the collection indexes are zero-based, the first element is at index 0 and the last element is at index Count-1.

  • Item(Int32)

    Gets or sets a TemplateGroup object at the specified index in the collection.

    public System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateGroup this[int index] { get; set; }

    Parameters

    • index
      Int32

      The zero-based index of the TemplateGroup to get or set in the collection.

    Property Value

    • TemplateGroup

      The TemplateGroup at index in the collection.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentOutOfRangeException

      value is less than zero.

      - or -

      value is greater than the stem.Web.UI.Design.TemplateGroupCollection.Count* property.

    Remarks

    Use the Item indexer to retrieve the group at a specified index within the collection or to set the group at a specified index within the collection. You can index elements in the collection by using array notation. For example, you can index an element at index i with the notation TemplateGroups(i) for Microsoft VisualBasic or TemplateGroups[i] for C#.

    When you have a reference to the group object and need the index of the object in the collection, use the IndexOf method.

Methods

  • Add(TemplateGroup)

    Adds the specified TemplateGroup object to the end of the collection.

    public int Add (System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateGroup group);

    Parameters

    • group
      TemplateGroup

      The TemplateGroup to add to the collection.

    Returns

    • Int32

      The index at which the TemplateGroup was added to the collection.

    Remarks

    The Add method adds the specified TemplateGroup object to the end of the collection. To add a TemplateGroup object to the collection at a specific index location, use the Insert method.

    To add multiple groups to the collection, use the AddRange method.

  • AddRange(TemplateGroupCollection)

    Adds the template groups in an existing TemplateGroupCollection object to the current TemplateGroupCollection object.

    public void AddRange (System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateGroupCollection groups);

    Parameters

    • groups
      TemplateGroupCollection

      A TemplateGroupCollection that contains the groups to add to the collection.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      groups is null.

    Remarks

    The AddRange method adds multiple groups to the collection. To add a single TemplateGroup object to the end of the collection, use the Add method. To add a TemplateGroup object to the collection at a specific index location, use the Insert method.

  • Clear()

    Removes all groups from the collection.

    public void Clear ();

    Remarks

    Use the Clear method to remove all groups from the collection. To remove a specific group from the collection, use the Remove method. To remove a group at a particular index, use the RemoveAt method.

  • Contains(TemplateGroup)

    Determines whether the specified group is contained within the collection.

    public bool Contains (System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateGroup group);

    Parameters

    • group
      TemplateGroup

      The TemplateGroup to locate within the collection.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the group is in the collection; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    The Contains method determines equality by using the Equals method on the TemplateGroup objects.

    The Contains method performs a linear search; therefore, the average execution time is proportional to the Count property. Because template group collections typically are small, the performance of the linear search operation is not critical.

  • CopyTo(TemplateGroup[],Int32)

    Copies the groups in the collection to a compatible one-dimensional array, starting at the specified index of the target array.

    public void CopyTo (System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateGroup[] array, int index);

    Parameters

    • array
      TemplateGroup[]

      The Array that is the destination of the copied groups. The Array must have zero-based indexing.

    • index
      Int32

      The zero-based index in array at which copying begins.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentException

      array is multidimensional.

      -or-

      index is greater than or equal to the length of array.

      -or-

      The number of elements in the source TemplateGroupCollection is greater than the available space from index to the end of array.

    • ArgumentOutOfRangeException

      index is less than zero.

    • ArgumentNullException

      array is null.

    Remarks

    The group elements are copied to the Array object in the same order in which the group elements are indexed within the TemplateGroupCollection object.

  • IndexOf(TemplateGroup)

    Returns the index of the specified TemplateGroup object within the collection.

    public int IndexOf (System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateGroup group);

    Parameters

    • group
      TemplateGroup

      The TemplateGroup to locate within the collection.

    Returns

    • Int32

      The zero-based index of the first occurrence of group within the collection; otherwise, -1, if group is not in the collection.

    Remarks

    The IndexOf method determines equality by using the Equals method on the TemplateGroup objects.

    The IndexOf performs a linear search; therefore, the average execution time is proportional to the Count property. Because template group collections typically are small, the performance of the linear search operation is not critical.

  • Insert(Int32,TemplateGroup)

    Inserts a TemplateGroup object into the collection at the specified index.

    public void Insert (int index, System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateGroup group);

    Parameters

    • index
      Int32

      The zero-based index within the collection at which to insert group.

    • group
      TemplateGroup

      The TemplateGroup to insert into the collection.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentOutOfRangeException

      index is less than zero.

      - or -

      index is greater than the stem.Web.UI.Design.TemplateGroupCollection.Count* property.

    Remarks

    The Insert method adds a TemplateGroup object to the collection at a specific index location. To add a single TemplateGroup to the end of the collection, use the Add method. To add multiple groups to the collection, use the AddRange method.

    Note

    When you insert an item into the collection, the indexes change for subsequent items in the collection.

  • Remove(TemplateGroup)

    Removes the specified TemplateGroup object from the collection.

    public void Remove (System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateGroup group);

    Parameters

    • group
      TemplateGroup

      The TemplateGroup to remove from the collection.

    Remarks

    The Remove method removes the first occurrence of group from the collection. If the TemplateGroupCollection object does not contain group, the collection remains unchanged. No exception is thrown.

    The Remove method determines equality by using the Equals method on the TemplateGroup objects.

    The Remove method performs a linear search; therefore, the average execution time is proportional to the Count property. Because template group collections typically are small, the performance of the linear search operation is not critical.

    To remove a group at a particular index from the collection, use the RemoveAt method. To remove all the groups from the collection, use the Clear method.

    Note

    When you remove an item from the collection, the indexes change for subsequent items in the collection.

  • RemoveAt(Int32)

    Removes the TemplateGroup object at the specified index within the collection.

    public void RemoveAt (int index);

    Parameters

    • index
      Int32

      The zero-based index within the collection of the TemplateGroup to remove.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentOutOfRangeException

      index is less than zero.

      - or -

      index is greater than the stem.Web.UI.Design.TemplateGroupCollection.Count* property.

    Remarks

    Use the RemoveAt method to remove a group at a particular index from the collection. To remove a specified group from the collection, use the Remove method. To remove all the groups from the collection, use the Clear method.

    Note

    When you remove an item from the collection, the indexes change for subsequent items in the collection.

Explicit Interface Implementations

  • ICollection.CopyTo(Array,Int32)

    For a description of this member, see stem.Collections.ICollection.CopyTo*.

    void ICollection.CopyTo (Array array, int index);

    Parameters

    • array
      Array

      The Array that is the destination of the copied groups. The Array must have zero-based indexing.

    • index
      Int32

      The zero-based index in array at which copying begins.

    Remarks

    This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the TemplateGroupCollection instance is cast to an ICollection interface.

  • ICollection.Count

    For a description of this member, see stem.Collections.ICollection.Count*.

    int System.Collections.ICollection.Count { get; }

    Returns

    • Int32

      The number of elements in the TemplateGroupCollection.

    Remarks

    This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the TemplateGroupCollection instance is cast to an ICollection interface.

  • ICollection.IsSynchronized

    For a description of this member, see stem.Collections.ICollection.IsSynchronized*.

    bool System.Collections.ICollection.IsSynchronized { get; }

    Returns

    • Boolean

      false, if access to the TemplateGroupCollection is not synchronized (thread safe); otherwise, true.

    Remarks

    This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the TemplateGroupCollection instance is cast to an ICollection interface.

  • ICollection.SyncRoot

    For a description of this member, see stem.Collections.ICollection.SyncRoot*.

    object System.Collections.ICollection.SyncRoot { get; }

    Returns

    • System.Object

      An object to use to synchronize access to the TemplateGroupCollection.

    Remarks

    This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the TemplateGroupCollection instance is cast to an ICollection interface.

  • IEnumerable.GetEnumerator()

    For a description of this member, see stem.Collections.IEnumerable.GetEnumerator*.

    System.Collections.IEnumerator IEnumerable.GetEnumerator ();

    Returns

    • IEnumerator

      An IEnumerator to use to iterate through the collection.

    Remarks

    This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the TemplateGroupCollection instance is cast to an IEnumerable interface.

  • IList.Add(Object)

    For a description of this member, see stem.Collections.IList.Add*.

    int IList.Add (object o);

    Parameters

    • o
      System.Object

      The TemplateGroup to add to the collection.

    Returns

    • Int32

      The index at which o was added to the collection.

    Remarks

    This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the TemplateGroupCollection instance is cast to an IList interface.

  • IList.Clear()

    For a description of this member, see stem.Collections.IList.Clear*.

    void IList.Clear ();

    Remarks

    This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the TemplateGroupCollection instance is cast to an IList interface.

  • IList.Contains(Object)

    For a description of this member, see stem.Collections.IList.Contains*.

    bool IList.Contains (object o);

    Parameters

    • o
      System.Object

      The TemplateGroup to locate within the collection.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true, if o is in the collection; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the TemplateGroupCollection instance is cast to an IList interface.

  • IList.IndexOf(Object)

    For a description of this member, see stem.Collections.IList.IndexOf*.

    int IList.IndexOf (object o);

    Parameters

    • o
      System.Object

      The TemplateGroup to locate within the collection.

    Returns

    • Int32

      The zero-based index of the first occurrence of o within the collection; otherwise, -1, if o is not in the collection.

    Remarks

    This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the TemplateGroupCollection instance is cast to an IList interface.

  • IList.Insert(Int32,Object)

    For a description of this member, see stem.Collections.IList.Insert*.

    void IList.Insert (int index, object o);

    Parameters

    • index
      Int32

      The zero-based index within the collection at which to insert o.

    • o
      System.Object

      The object to insert into the collection.

    Remarks

    This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the TemplateGroupCollection instance is cast to an IList interface.

  • IList.IsFixedSize

    For a description of this member, see stem.Collections.IList.IsFixedSize*.

    bool System.Collections.IList.IsFixedSize { get; }

    Returns

    • Boolean

      false, if the TemplateGroupCollection dynamically increases as new objects are added; otherwise, true.

    Remarks

    This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the TemplateGroupCollection instance is cast to an IList interface.

  • IList.IsReadOnly

    For a description of this member, see stem.Collections.IList.IsReadOnly*.

    bool System.Collections.IList.IsReadOnly { get; }

    Returns

    • Boolean

      false, if the TemplateGroupCollection can be added, modified, and removed; otherwise, true.

    Remarks

    This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the TemplateGroupCollection instance is cast to an IList interface.

  • IList.Item(Int32)

    For a description of this member, see the IList class.

    object System.Collections.IList.Item[int index] { get; set; }

    Parameters

    • index
      Int32

      The zero-based index of the object to get in the collection.

    Returns

    • System.Object

      The object at index in the collection.

    Remarks

    This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the TemplateGroupCollection instance is cast to an IList interface.

  • IList.Remove(Object)

    For a description of this member, see stem.Collections.IList.Remove*.

    void IList.Remove (object o);

    Parameters

    • o
      System.Object

      The object to remove from the collection.

    Remarks

    This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the TemplateGroupCollection instance is cast to an IList interface.

  • IList.RemoveAt(Int32)

    For a description of this member, see stem.Collections.IList.RemoveAt*.

    void IList.RemoveAt (int index);

    Parameters

    • index
      Int32

      The zero-based index within the collection of the object to remove.

    Remarks

    This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the TemplateGroupCollection instance is cast to an IList interface.
